snippet: The couple met through a gay volleyball league and learned over brunch that they had both taught English in China.
lead_paragraph: Samuel Jacob Zalutsky and Edward Martin Boland are to be married Sunday evening at Studio 450, an event space in Manhattan. Piper E. Kerman, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, is to officiate. Mr. Zalutsky (left), 42, is a filmmaker in Manhattan. He wrote, directed and produced ''You Belong to Me,'' a psychological thriller that appeared on pay-per-view television and was released on DVD in 2008. His other work includes ''Stefan's Silver Bell'' (2001) and ''SuperStore'' (2004), short narrative films that later appeared on the WNET television series ''Reel New York.'' He is also a screenwriting instructor at Spalding University in Louisville, Ky. He graduated from Yale and received a Master of Fine Arts degree in film from New York University.
